Pathway.Name: EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitor resistance
Pathway.Comment: Tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs) are drugs that inhibit the phosphorylation, and subsequent activation, of tyrosine kinases. TKIs are typically used as cancer therapeutics, but development of resistance to TKIs in cancers is common. This pathway describes several mechanisms of TKI resistance in the context of EGFR signaling. Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor, EGFR, is a transmembrane tyrosine kinase that binds to the EGF-family of ligands. It activates several downstream signaling cascades, including MAPK, and leads to DNA synthesis and cell proliferation. Mutations and over-expression in EGFR is implicated in many cancers. The section of the pathway outlined in pink corresponds to mechanisms of TKI resistance.

Label.TextLabel: Tyrosine Kinase Inhibitors Ineffective due to EGFR mutation
Inactivating mutation or loss of heterozygosity

bp:PublicationXref.bp:TITLE: EGF mutant receptor vIII as a molecular target in cancer therapy.
Reduced NF1 expression confers resistance to EGFR inhibition in lung cancer.
KRAS gene amplification in colorectal cancer and impact on response to EGFR-targeted therapy.
A common BIM deletion polymorphism mediates intrinsic resistance and inferior responses to tyrosine kinase inhibitors in cancer.
De-repression of PDGFRβ transcription promotes acquired resistance to EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitors in glioblastoma patients.

bp:openControlledVocabulary.bp:TERM: altered tyrosine-specific protein kinase mediated signaling pathway

bp:PublicationXref.bp:TITLE: MET amplification leads to gefitinib resistance in lung cancer by activating ERBB3 signaling.
FGFR1 activation is an escape mechanism in human lung cancer cells resistant to afatinib, a pan-EGFR family kinase inhibitor.
Insulin-like growth factor (IGF) signaling in tumorigenesis and the development of cancer drug resistance.
Autocrine production of interleukin 6 causes multidrug resistance in breast cancer cells.
Up-regulation of miR-21 by HER2/neu signaling promotes cell invasion.
AXL kinase as a novel target for cancer therapy.

bp:openControlledVocabulary.bp:TERM: tyrosine-specific protein kinase mediated signaling pathway

bp:PublicationXref.bp:TITLE: Lung cancers with acquired resistance to EGFR inhibitors occasionally harbor BRAF gene mutations but lack mutations in KRAS, NRAS, or MEK1.
bp:PublicationXref.bp:SOURCE: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A
